imagingbook.jgraphix

Class DrawFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • imagingbook.jgraphix.DrawFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class DrawFrame
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener
    This class provides a simple setup for performing non-interactive drawing operations in Java. It is intended for educational use and is neither safe nor recommended for real applications. The implementation is based on Swing and AWT graphics. All standard AWT graphics operations can be used (see the Graphics2D API documentation for details). The rendered screen graphics can be saved to a PNG file by pressing Ctrl-s (Windows) or Cmd-s (MacOS) on the open window.

    Typical usage example: 

     import java.awt.Color;
 import java.awt.Font;
 import java.awt.Graphics2D;
 import java.awt.geom.Line2D;
 
 import imagingbook.jgraphix.DrawFrame;
 
 ...
 
 DrawFrame df = DrawFrame.create();
 Graphics2D g = df.getGraphics2D();
    
 g.setStroke(new BasicStroke(5));
 g.setColor(Color.blue);
    
 g.drawLine(40, 10, 10, 40);
 g.fillOval(10, 60, 30, 30);
 g.drawOval(60, 60, 30, 30);
 df.refresh();  // display drawing
    
 df.clear();    // erase drawing
 g.setColor(Color.green);
 g.fillRoundRect(110, 60, 30, 30, 10, 10);
 g.drawRoundRect(160, 60, 30, 30, 10, 10);
 df.refresh();  // display drawing
 ...

    Repository: https://github.com/imagingbook/JGraphix
    License: BSD 2-clause "Simplified" License

    Version:
    2017-11-18
    Author:
    W. Burger

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static DrawFrame create(java.lang.String title,
                               int width,
                               int height)
        Creates and returns a new DrawFrame instance or the existing (singleton) instance if already existent. Since only one instance of DrawFrame is permitted, this method should be called only once.
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the frame (displayed in the window's top bar)
        width - The width of the actual drawing area.
        height - The height of the actual drawing area.
        Returns:
        An instance of DrawFrame.

      • create

        public static DrawFrame create()
        Creates and returns a new DrawFrame instance or the existing (singleton) instance if already existent. DEFAULT_TITLE, DEFAULT_WIDTH and DEFAULT_HEIGHT are used to specify the title and size of the actual drawing area. Since only one instance of DrawFrame is permitted, this method should be called only once.
        Returns:
        An instance of DrawFrame.

      • getGraphics2D

        public java.awt.Graphics2D getGraphics2D()
        Retrieves the Graphics2D instance for drawing into this DrawFrame.
        Returns:
        The Graphics2D instance.

      • getW

        public int getW()
        Returns the width of the actual (inner) drawing area.
        Returns:
        The width of the drawing area.

      • getH

        public int getH()
        Returns the height of the actual (inner) drawing area.
        Returns:
        The height of the drawing area.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the drawing area and fills it with the specified BACKGROUND_COLOR.

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
        Displays the current graphics in the screen window of this DrawFrame. Note that all graphics are initially drawn to a hidden image, which is not automatically displayed.

      • keyTyped

        public void keyTyped(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)

      • saveTo

        public boolean saveTo(java.io.File file)
        Saves the current graphics as PNG raster image.
        Parameters:
        file - A File instance specifying the path of the PNG file.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, false otherwise.

      • sleep

        public static void sleep(long ms)
        Suspend program execution for the specified time. This is only an exception-free (convenience) wrapper around the Thread.sleep(long) method.
        Parameters:
        ms - time to wait in milliseconds
